title: Their free plan offers acting as HTTPS proxy to your HTTP-only website.

inline_content.Text: Their free plan offers acting as HTTPS proxy to your HTTP-only website.

title: To use Cloudflare: * configure your domain to use CloudFlare’s DNS servers * in CloudFlare’s DNS settings point the domain to your server and set Status to “DNS and HTTP proxy (CDN)” * in CloudFlare’s Crypto settings, set SSL to “Flexible” (browser talks to CloudFlare via HTTPS, CloudFlare talks to * configure CloudFlare’s HTTPS proxy in their web interface by providing IP address of your server. * for good measure, also enable “Always use HTTPS”

title: Not long ago, if you wanted a SSL certificate, you had to pay many dollars a year for each domain.

title: Let’s Encrypt
a
https://letsencrypt.org/
changed that. It’s a non-profit organization that provides certificates for free and offers HTTP API for obtaining certificates. API allows automating the process.

inline_content.Text: Let’s Encrypt
changed that. It’s a non-profit organization that provides certificates for free and offers HTTP API for obtaining certificates. API allows automating the process.

title: Before Let’s Encrypt you would buy a certificate, which is just a bunch of bytes. You would save certificate to a file and configure your web server to use it.

title: How certificates came to be free

inline_content.Text: How certificates came to be free

title: Arguably due to a design mistake, SSL protocol not only encrypts but also proves site’s identity to the browser.

inline_content.Text: Arguably due to a design mistake, SSL protocol not only encrypts but also proves site’s identity to the browser.

title: It provides accountability so that we can trace the ownership of google.com and see that it is indeed owned by Google, Inc in US, and not Ivan The Hacker in Moscow.

inline_content.Text: It provides accountability so that we can trace the ownership of google.com and see that it is indeed owned by Google, Inc in US, and not Ivan The Hacker in Moscow.

title: We implement that accountability by trusting a very small number of companies (Certificate Authorities) to issue certificates that prove the identity of the website owner.

inline_content.Text: We implement that accountability by trusting a very small number of companies (Certificate Authorities) to issue certificates that prove the identity of the website owner.

title: When you apply for a certificate, Certificate Authority has to verify your identity. They do it by checking your papers.

inline_content.Text: When you apply for a certificate, Certificate Authority has to verify your identity. They do it by checking your papers.

title: Verifying the papers requires labor. Keeping certificates safe requires labor. It’s reasonable that Certificate Authorities charge for the service of issuing certifcates.

inline_content.Text: Verifying the papers requires labor. Keeping certificates safe requires labor. It’s reasonable that Certificate Authorities charge for the service of issuing certifcates.

title: The trust doesn’t scale. Browser and OS vendors can trust 10 companies to not issue invalid certificates, but they can’t trust a thousand.

inline_content.Text: The trust doesn’t scale. Browser and OS vendors can trust 10 companies to not issue invalid certificates, but they can’t trust a thousand.

title: We don’t want any random company to become a rogue certificate authority and start issuing certificates for google.com domains to Ivan The Hacker.

inline_content.Text: We don’t want any random company to become a rogue certificate authority and start issuing certificates for google.com domains to Ivan The Hacker.

title: It would be too much effort to continuosly audit thousands of Certificate Authority companies so as a result we ended up with just a few.

inline_content.Text: It would be too much effort to continuosly audit thousands of Certificate Authority companies so as a result we ended up with just a few.

title: A market controlled by small number of companies tends to become a cartel that keeps prices high due to lack of competition.

inline_content.Text: A market controlled by small number of companies tends to become a cartel that keeps prices high due to lack of competition.

title: That’s exactly what happened in SSL certificates market. You can have a low-end server for $60/year and a certificate alone would cost more than that.

inline_content.Text: That’s exactly what happened in SSL certificates market. You can have a low-end server for $60/year and a certificate alone would cost more than that.

title: That was a problem because the cost of SSL certificates was a significant barrier to adopting encryption by all websites.

inline_content.Text: That was a problem because the cost of SSL certificates was a significant barrier to adopting encryption by all websites.

title: A few companies decided to pool their resources and solve that problem for the greater good of the web.

inline_content.Text: A few companies decided to pool their resources and solve that problem for the greater good of the web.

title: They funded Let’s Encrypt which became a Certificate Authority, wrote necessary software and is running the servers that do the work of issuing certificates. It’s been a
raging success
a
//letsencrypt.org/2017/06/28/hundred-million-certs.html

inline_content.Text: They funded Let’s Encrypt which became a Certificate Authority, wrote necessary software and is running the servers that do the work of issuing certificates. It’s been a
raging success

title: And that’s how free certificates came to be.
